title: Terry Gale
text:
Terry R. Gale (born 7 June 1946) is an Australian professional <a href="golf">golf</a>er.
Professional career.
Gale had a successful amateur career before turning professional at a relatively advanced age in 1976. From the mid-1970s to the early 1990s he won regularly on the <a href="PGA%20Tour%20of%20Australasia">PGA Tour of Australasia</a>, the <a href="Japan%20Golf%20Tour">Japan Golf Tour</a>, and the <a href="Asia%20Golf%20Circuit">Asia Golf Circuit</a>. Since turning fifty he has been a member of the <a href="European%20Seniors%20Tour">European Seniors Tour</a>, where he has won seven tournaments. His best season on that tour was 2003, when he finished third on the Order of Merit. He also plays on the <a href="Japanese%20Seniors%20Tour">Japanese Seniors Tour</a>.
Personal life.
Gale originally worked as a sheep farmer.
Off the course, Gale was the second Chairman of the PGA Tour of Australasia. His son, <a href="Mark%20Gale">Mark Gale</a> was a professional <a href="Australian%20rules%20football">Australian rules football</a>er. Gale was also a talented cricketer in his youth, representing his state on occasion, although never at First Class level.
